algorithm_technique: Iterate backwards through the string, counting non-space characters until a space is encountered.
Split the string by spaces and take the length of the last non-empty element.
problem_summary_simple: Find the length of the last word in a given string, ignoring trailing spaces.
problem_summary_technical: Iterate from the end of the string, counting characters until a space is found, or split and access the last word.
key_insights: Iterating from the end is efficient as we only care about the last word.
Handle trailing spaces by continuing to skip them until a non-space character is found.
The first non-space character encountered from the right marks the start of the last word.
String manipulation (strip and split) provides a concise solution.
The `strip()` method handles leading/trailing spaces effectively.
Accessing the last element of the split array gives the last word.
